frame.name: Fairness_evaluation
frame.definition:
<def-root>In this frame an <fen>Action</fen> is evaluated with respect to how fairly, justly or equitably the <fen>Action</fen> affects the <fen>Affected_party</fen>. An <fen>Actor</fen> may also be identified, who performs the <fen>Action</fen> and may be characterized as fair, unfair, etc. based on how these actions affect the <fen>Affected_party</fen>. <fen>Grounds</fen> may also be identified.
<ex><fex name="Actor">Smithers</fex> was being <fex name="Degree">very</fex> <t>fair</t> <fex name="Grounds">about the distribution of supplies</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Actor">Smithers</fex> was being <fex name="Degree">very</fex> <t>fair</t> <fex name="Action">about distributing the supplies</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Action">The decision</fex> was <t>fair</t> <fex name="Affected_party">to all involved</fex>.</ex> <ex> It was not <t>fair</t> <fex name="Action">for the warning to remain in place</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Actor">The company</fex> was <t>unfair</t> <fex name="Affected_party">to its loyal employees</fex>.</ex> <ex>Smith received a <t>fair</t> <fex name="Action">trial</fex>.</ex> <ex> <fex name="Action">The student loan system</fex> is <fex name="Parameter">socially</fex> <t>unjust</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Actor
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Actor</fen> is the individual who performs the <fen>Action</fen> and can thus be characterized with repsect to how that <fen>Action</fen> affects the <fen>Affected_party</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Action
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Action</fen> is judged based on how just and appopriate it is to the <fen>Affected_party</fen> in a particular situation.</def-root>

FE.name: Grounds
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Grounds</fen> is the event or state that requires some decision or action in response to it for which the <fen>Actor</fen> is judged.</def-root>

FE.name: Affected_party
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Affected_party</fen>'s treatment is what determines the evaluation of the <fen>Actor</fen>'s <fen>Action</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Degree</fen> is the extent to which the <fen>Action</fen> or <fen>Actor</fen> is evaluated as being fair or unfair.</def-root>

FE.name: Parameter
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Parameter</fen> is the area in which the <fen>Action</fen> is judged.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>A holistic characterization of the description of the <fen>Actor</fen>, including depictions of the <fen>Actor</fen>'s state in terms of how it affects the entire description.
<ex>You have been <fex name="Manner">cruelly</fex> <t>unfair</t> to me !</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: fair.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: just or appropriate in the circumstances.

lexUnit.name: unfair.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not based on or showing fairness; unjust.

lexUnit.name: fairly.adv
lexUnit.definition: FN: (do something) so as to have a fair outcome.

lexUnit.name: unfairly.adv
lexUnit.definition: FN: (do something) so as to have an unfair outcome.

lexUnit.name: unjustly.adv
lexUnit.definition: FN: (do something) so as to have an unfair outcome, with the implication that doing so lacks honor.
